Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student may draw a basic shape of a plant without distinguishing between healthy or unhealthy appearances.
The student might attempt to draw both a plant with and without water but may not show clear differences between their conditions.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to correctly depict a healthy plant as green and standing up (may not know what a healthy plant looks like).
The student may not represent an unhealthy plant as brown, wilting, or drooping (may think all plants look the same).
The student is unlikely to include a sunlight source in the drawing or understand its role (may not know plants need sunlight).
The student is unlikely to organize the drawing to clearly compare plants with and without water (may place drawings randomly).
The student may not use the drawing to explain that plants need water to live and grow (lacks understanding of the concept).
